A Japanese post office, featuring the „Äí Japanese postal mark on the front of the building.

Microsoft's design previously displayed this mark on its own instead of being featured on the building.

title: Japanese Post Office

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Building and map symbols

bn:00105516a: Of or relating to or characteristic of Japan or its people or their culture or language
Of, relating to, or derived from Japan, its language, or culture.

bn:00087150v: To admit to residence; to harbor/harbour.
To admit to residence; provide housing for.

bn:00084198v: Make by combining materials and parts
To create something by combining or assembling materials or parts or by changing it.
To form by combining materials or parts.
(transitive) to form by combining materials or parts.
To build or form (something) by assembling parts.
To form or formulate in the mind.

bn:00087441v: Inhabit or live in; be an inhabitant of
To fill with people or supply with inhabitants.
To supply with inhabitants; to people.
To have permanent residence somewhere, to inhabit, to reside.
To plant with inhabitants; to colonize; to people.

bn:00021221n: Communication is the activity of conveying information through the exchange of ideas, feelings, intentions, attitudes, expectations, perceptions or commands, as by speech, non-verbal gestures, writings, behavior and possibly by other means such as electromagnetic, chemical or physical phenomena and smell.
Conveying information through the exchange of thoughts, messages or information
The activity of communicating; the activity of conveying information
Navigation, surveillance", often associated with air traffic management as CNS/ATM
The concept or state of exchanging data or information between entities.
Communication is the activity of conveying information through the exchange of thoughts, messages, or information, as by speech, visuals, signals, writing, or behavior.

bn:00013722n: A building, esp. one of large size or imposing appearance.
A structure that has a roof and walls and stands more or less permanently in one place
Closed structure with walls and a roof.
A building is a man-made structure with a roof and walls standing more or less permanently in one place.
Structure with a roof and walls, such as a house or factory.
A closed structure with walls and a roof.
A building; a structure; an architectural fabric, especially an imposing one; a large or fine building, public or private.
Man-made structure with a roof and walls standing more or less permanently in one place
A building to which there is free access by the public and which is available for the use of a community.

bn:01448580n: Public corporation that offered postal service in Japan from 2003 to 2007
Japan Post was a government-owned corporation in Japan, that existed from 2003 -- 2007, offering postal and package delivery services, banking services, and life insurance.

bn:00047991n: The modern stage of the Japanese language, usually dated from around 1600.
Japanese language is an East Asian language spoken by about 125 million speakers, primarily in Japan, where it is the national language.
A native or inhabitant of Japan
A fictional creature in the Pok√©mon franchise
The main language spoken in Japan.
A language spoken mainly in Japan.

bn:00052815n: The mail or post is a system for physically transporting documents and other small packages, as well as a name for the postcards, letters, and parcels themselves.
The letters, parcels etc delivered to a particular address or person.

Mail, or post, is a system for transporting letters and other tangible objects: written documents, typically enclosed in envelopes, and also small packages are delivered to destinations around the world.
The system whereby messages are transmitted via the post office
A message or topic published on a blog, message board or Help board.
A single delivery of letters; the letters or deliveries that make up a single batch delivered to one person or one address.
System for transporting documents and other small packages
A batch of letters and parcels received via post.
